name: Mile-A-Minute Vine - Polygonum perfoliatum
description: Mile-a-Minute vine has light blue-green triangular leaves.  Spines are present on the leaf stalks, stems, and underside of leaves along the veins.
appearance: Light blue-green leaves are triangular and 1-3” (2-8cm) wide.
Thin, jointed, highly branched stems are green to reddish-green in color.
Curving spines are present on the leaf stalks, stems, and underside of leaves along the veins.
A leaf-like cup of tissue (ocrea) surrounds the stem at the base of the leaf stalk.
Metallic blue, berry-like, pea-sized (5mm) fruits are present from mid July through the first frost.
Plants are annuals that form a highly branched vine capable of growing over trees and shrubs.
